intro: Neodryas sacciana, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy foliage and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Neodryas sacciana is adapted to arid environments and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
